docs.snippet: At a meeting of this Board last evening, a resolution was adopted calling upon the City Inspector to report to the Board the number of removals of Health Wardens made by him since the 1st inst., and the authority by which such removals were made.

headline.main: BOARD OF COUNCILMEN.; APPOINTMENT OF STANDING COMMITTEES.

docs.lead_paragraph: At a meeting of this Board last evening, a resolution was adopted calling upon the City Inspector to report to the Board the number of removals of Health Wardens made by him since the 1st inst., and the authority by which such removals were made.

headline.main: HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES.; BOARD OF SUPERVISORS. VETO FROM THE MAYOR ON THE CITY CHAMBERLAIN QUESTION THE HARLEM BRIDGE CASE A NICE BILL AND ANOTHER NUT FOR LAWYERS TO CRACK. At the regular meeting of the Board yesterday, after the reception of petitions, bills and resolutions, which were appropriately referred, the following veto from the Mayor was received and ordered printed in the regular papers:

docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. WHITELY, of Delaware (Dem.,) presented resolutions from the State of Delaware urging the adoption of the Crittenden Compromise.

docs.snippet: We have more than once alluded to the certainty of an "irrepressible conflict" between different sections and rival interests of the Southern States, as soon as they attempt to organize a Confederacy of their own. We mentioned a day or two since...
docs.lead_paragraph: We have more than once alluded to the certainty of an "irrepressible conflict" between different sections and rival interests of the Southern States, as soon as they attempt to organize a Confederacy of their own. We mentioned a day or two since Western Virginia and Northern Alabama as not at all likely to submit to the attempted coercion of the Slavetrade interest which is at the bottom of the Disunion movement.

headline.main: JAMAICA.; The Legislature--A Recess--Increased Difficulties with the Governor--Breach ofPrivilege-Judge Ker--Revivals--Steam Communication with Cuba--Trade--Baneful Effects of the Secession Movement on Mercantile Affairs here, & c.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Legislature being out of session, on a recess of a few weeks, the political storm, of which I have already given you full accounts, has subsided; but I am afraid the lull is only a silent preparation for fresh disagreements between the Executive and the two Chambers, whenever members again assemble to proceed to business.
